column2: Today is the day the Alter Rebbe was released from prison after arrest from the Russian authorities.\nIt is a day of celebration for all Jews who follow the Rebbe! Farbregens are held for days to celebrate the release of the Alter Rebbe.
At a time of great conflict in the Jewish world, the Alter Rebbe was accused and imprisoned for treason. It is this day we mark his liberation from prison with a farbregen.
Your invitation to a farbregen was refused!
The Farbregen is large and lasts for days, niggunim are sung into the night, and Tanya is recited for hours.\n
Yechi Adoneinu Moreinu V'Rabbeinu L'olam Va'ed!
The Farbregen has ended, and everyone has returned back to their estates.
Yud-Tes Kislev is the celebration of the liberation of the Alter Rebbe from imprisonment at the hands of the Russians. Celebrate a Farbregen with your vassals to mark the day!
This character has began a period of intense study of the Talmud at a prominent yeshiva
This character is considered an especially learned scholar of Talmud and Halakha.
While not especially distinguished, this character has a well-rounded knowledge of Talmud and Halakha.

As your child is soon of age you can choose to hold an extravagant Bar Mitzvah for [Root.GetHerHim], inviting your vassals and the members of your court. This can help build trust that will certainly prove useful for the child in the future.
Begin your journey as a student of Talmud and Torah by attending a prominent Yeshiva in the region.

The day of [bar_mitzvah_target.GetBestName]'s Bar Mitzvah is soon approaching, and excitement builds in the palace. Your Rabbi [Root.job_spiritual.GetBestName] has offered to personally prepare [bar_mitzvah_target.GetHerHim] in the final month, to read from the Torah and give a D'var Torah as well.
I can prepare [bar_mitzvah_target.GetBestName] for the Bar Mitzvah myself!
[bar_mitzvah_target.GetBestName] can figure it out on [bar_mitzvah_target.GetHerHis] own.

The day has arrived. At your family's synagogue [bar_mitzvah_target.GetBestName] approaches the bimah brimming with a regal confidence. [bar_mitzvah_target.GetSheHeCap] reads [bar_mitzvah_target.GetHerHis] Torah portion effortlessly, followed by a D'var Torah on the portion that impresses even the most cynical of your vassals.

The day has arrived. At your family's synagogue [bar_mitzvah_target.GetBestName] approaches the bimah shaking nervously. [bar_mitzvah_target.GetSheHeCap] stumbles [bar_mitzvah_target.GetHerHis] way through the passage, constantly stopping for corrections from the gabbai. Your vassals cringe in pity as [bar_mitzvah_target.GetFirstName] attempts to deliver a clumsy D'var Torah clearly written the night before.

In the celebration after, you see [bar_mitzvah_target.GetBestName] and [compliment_vassal.GetBestName] discussing intently some issue brought up in [bar_mitzvah_target.GetHerHis] D'var Torah, with [bar_mitzvah_target.GetFirstName] displaying a maturity you didn't realize [bar_mitzvah_target.GetSheHe] had. Afterwards [compliment_vassal.GetFirstName] pull you aside to tell you just how impressed [compliment_vassal.GetSheHe] is.

In the celebration after, you see [bar_mitzvah_target.GetBestName] and [insult_vassal.GetBestName] arguing, when [bar_mitzvah_target.GetFirstName] suddenly jumps up out of [bar_mitzvah_target.GetHerHis] seat, flailing at [insult_vassal.GetFirstName] until your guards are able to pull [bar_mitzvah_target.GetHerHim] away. [insult_vassal.GetFirstName] calls out to you: "is this how your family treats guests?".

It seems as if [bar_mitzvah_target.GetFirstName] has started getting along incredibly well with the child of one of the visiting vassals! Indeed, apparently [bar_mitzvah_target.GetFirstName] and [befriended_child.GetBestName] are becoming fast friends.

While having a pleasant conversation you are suddenly interrupted by an infernal ruckus, upon further investigation it seems as if [bar_mitzvah_target.GetFirstName] has gotten into a fight with the child of one of the visiting vassals! You tear the two children apart, but it is obvious that [bar_mitzvah_target.GetFirstName] and [rival_child.GetBestName] will not ever be friends after this encounter...

As the hours go by you notice [bar_mitzvah_target.GetFirstName]'s mood starting to drop. [bar_mitzvah_target.GetSheHeCap] is obviously still upset about the embarassment at [bar_mitzvah_target.GetHerHis] Bar Mitzvah. Hopefully this slump in [bar_mitzvah_target.GetFirstName]'s mood will pass soon.

After a long night of celebration, the Bar Mitzvah is finally over. After all the stresses of the day, [bar_mitzvah_target.GetFirstName] retires to [bar_mitzvah_target.GetHerHis] chambers and wishes you good night. For better or worse, you look on the child you raised, finally grown to adulthood, and wonder what [bar_mitzvah_target.GetHerHis] future will bring.
A New letter has arrived from the Rosh Yeshiva: you have been accepted as a student! Soon you will pack your bags and begin your studying under great scholars of Talmud.

The Head Rabbi of your Yeshiva has found a fellow student [chevruta_partner.GetBestName], who will be your chevruta, a constant companion in study throughtout your time there. The Rabbi reminds you that as "Iron sharpens iron, so a man sharpens the countenance of his friend". You hope this new friend is sharp enough to help you on your path of learning.

You have been looking at the same Daf for what feels like ages, trying to find some way to understand the argument. You turn to [chevruta_partner.GetFirstName] who pulls out another commentary [chevruta_partner.GetSheHe] read which clarified things.
I am blessed to have such a capable chaver.

[chevruta_partner.GetFirstName] has come to you after looking at the same Daf for what feels like ages, trying to find some way to understand the argument. After a moment of contemplation you pull out another commentary you hope will help [chevruta_partner.GetHerHim].

You have been looking at the same Daf for what feels like ages, trying to find some way to understand the argument. You turn to [chevruta_partner.GetFirstName] who confuses you further with some nonsense.
After [root.GetHerHis] Bar Mitzvah, [root.GetFirstName] has impressed the nearby Jewish community with [root.GetHerHis] performance.
After [root.GetHerHis] Bar Mitzvah, [root.GetFirstName] has disappointed the nearby Jewish community with [root.GetHerHis] performance.
